channel.title: Comments on: You’re not special, and no one cares about you

item.title: By: Shantnu
item.dc:creator: Shantnu
item.description:
There are a few good sites, but they keep changing.
Currently, dev.to is considered friendly, though this may change in a few years.
If you regularly follow programming links on places like Reddit or hacker news, you are bound to find friendly sites
item.content:encoded:
There are a few good sites, but they keep changing.

Currently, dev.to is considered friendly, though this may change in a few years.

If you regularly follow programming links on places like Reddit or hacker news, you are bound to find friendly sites

item.title: By: George
item.dc:creator: George
item.description:
I am currently having similar issues. I am architect of my own project. It works, have proven it to work, but I cannot show my strategy. I need it converted from what it is to another language, but only a small part. Would be about 20 lines of Python code. I have read beginner books, .py forums, asked in otehr forums where I KNOW they have the solution, but no. RTFM....or replies similar, just candy coated replies worded in such a way as if this game is going on, how to mess with the person asking the question if they are new.
So, where do we "mortals" go to have Python codes snippets answered, and then be on our way ?
item.content:encoded:
I am currently having similar issues. I am architect of my own project. It works, have proven it to work, but I cannot show my strategy. I need it converted from what it is to another language, but only a small part. Would be about 20 lines of Python code.
I have read beginner books, .py forums, asked in otehr forums where I KNOW they have the solution, but no. RTFM….or replies similar, just candy coated replies worded in such a way as if this game is going on, how to mess with the person asking the question if they are new.

So, where do we “mortals” go to have Python codes snippets answered, and then be on our way ?

item.title: By: Thomas
item.dc:creator: Thomas
item.description:
I am a software developer...and found your article really good :)
There is a real problem in the programmers community : arrogance.
I think what most of us programmers lack is maturity. I see a lot of people complaining about being misunderstood and let down, but they do the same thing to their managers/colleagues.
But of course it's not always black or white, you can work on your attitude, I try to do it as much as possible and I really see the benefits.
However, I'll never use StackOverflow again, this is the perfect example of a community gone horribly wrong.
item.content:encoded:
I am a software developer…and found your article really good ðŸ™‚

There is a real problem in the programmers community : arrogance.

I think what most of us programmers lack is maturity. I see a lot of people complaining about being misunderstood and let down, but they do the same thing to their managers/colleagues.

But of course it’s not always black or white, you can work on your attitude, I try to do it as much as possible and I really see the benefits.

However, I’ll never use StackOverflow again, this is the perfect example of a community gone horribly wrong.

item.title: By: M
item.dc:creator: M
item.description: And if you can't get over it, just become a serial killer. "They didn't like my compiler!" *chop* *chop*
item.content:encoded: And if you can’t get over it, just become a serial killer. “They didn’t like my compiler!” *chop* *chop*
